param.name: APMrover2:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: APMrover2:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of what log types to enable in on-board logger. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. On boards supporting microSD cards or other large block-storage devices it is usually best just to enable all log types by setting this to 65535. The individual bits are ATTITUDE_FAST=1, ATTITUDE_MEDIUM=2, GPS=4, PerformanceMonitoring=8, ControlTuning=16, NavigationTuning=32, Mode=64, IMU=128, Commands=256, Battery=512, Compass=1024, TECS=2048, Camera=4096, RCandServo=8192, Rangefinder=16384, Arming=32768, FullLogs=65535

param.name: APMrover2:RST_SWITCH_CH
param.documentation: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

param.name: APMrover2:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usually used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_THIS_MAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: APMrover2:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: APMrover2:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

param.name: APMrover2:AUTO_KICKSTART
param.documentation: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

param.humanName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_SPEED
param.documentation: The target speed in auto missions.

param.name: APMrover2:CRUISE_THROTTLE
param.documentation: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

param.name: APMrover2:PILOT_STEER_TYPE
param.documentation: Set this to 1 for skid steering input rovers (tank track style in RC controller). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

param.name: APMrover2:FS_ACTION
param.documentation: What to do on a failsafe event

param.name: APMrover2:FS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition must persist before the failsafe action is triggered

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto

param.name: APMrover2:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on the throttle channel below which throttle failsafe triggers.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto

param.name: APMrover2:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: What to do on a crash event. When enabled the rover will go to hold if a crash is detected.

param.name: APMrover2:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: APMrover2:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: APMrover2:MODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

param.name: APMrover2:MODE1
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE2
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE3
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE4
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE5
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

param.name: APMrover2:MODE6
param.documentation: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

param.name: APMrover2:TURN_MAX_G
param.documentation: The maximum turning acceleration (in units of gravities) that the rover can handle while remaining stable. The navigation code will keep the lateral acceleration below this level to avoid rolling over or slipping the wheels in turns

param.name: APMrover2:SYSID_ENFORCE
param.documentation: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

param.name: APMrover2:TURN_RADIUS
param.documentation: Turn radius of vehicle in meters while at low speeds. Lower values produce tighter turns in steering mode

param.name: APMrover2:ACRO_TURN_RATE
param.documentation: Acro mode turn rate maximum

param.name: APMrover2:RTL_SPEED
param.documentation: Return-to-Launch speed default. If zero use WP_SPEED or CRUISE_SPEED.

param.name: APMrover2:FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Frame Class

param.name: APMrover2:BAL_PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: Pitch angle in degrees at 100% throttle

param.name: APMrover2:CRASH_ANGLE
param.documentation: Pitch/Roll angle limit in degrees for crash check. Zero disables check

param.name: APMrover2:FRAME_TYPE
param.documentation: Frame Type

param.name: APMrover2:LOIT_TYPE
param.documentation: Loiter behaviour when moving to the target point

values.value: Forward or reverse to target point
Always face bow towards target point

param.name: APMrover2:SIMPLE_TYPE
param.documentation: Simple mode types

param.name: APMrover2:LOIT_RADIUS
param.documentation: Vehicle will drift when within this distance of the target position

param.name: APMrover2:MIS_DONE_BEHAVE
param.documentation: Mode to become after mission done

param.name: APMrover2:BAL_PITCH_TRIM
param.documentation: Balance Bot pitch trim for balancing. This offsets the tilt of the center of mass.

param.name: APMrover2:STICK_MIXING
param.documentation: When enabled, this adds steering user stick input in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of control without changing modes.

param.name: APMrover2:SPEED_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum speed vehicle can obtain at full throttle. If 0, it will be estimated based on CRUISE_SPEED and CRUISE_THROTTLE.

param.name: APMrover2:LOIT_SPEED_GAIN
param.documentation: Determines how agressively LOITER tries to correct for drift from loiter point. Higher is faster but default should be acceptable.

param.name: APMrover2:CH7_OPTION
param.documentation: What to do use channel 7 for

param.name: APMrover2:AUX_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for auxiliary functions including saving waypoints

param.name: APMrover2:PIVOT_TURN_ANGLE
param.documentation: Navigation angle threshold in degrees to switch to pivot steering when SKID_STEER_OUT is 1. This allows you to setup a skid steering rover to turn on the spot in auto mode when the angle it needs to turn it greater than this angle. An angle of zero means to disable pivot turning. Note that you will probably also want to set a low value for WP_RADIUS to get neat turns.

param.name: APMrover2:PIVOT_TURN_RATE
param.documentation: Desired pivot turn rate in deg/s.

param.name: AFS_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

param.name: AFS_MAN_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode

param.name: AFS_HB_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination.

param.name: AFS_WP_COMMS
param.documentation: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

param.name: AFS_GPS_LOSS
param.documentation: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

param.name: AFS_TERMINATE
param.documentation: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

param.name: AFS_TERM_ACTION
param.documentation: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup APM to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

param.name: AFS_TERM_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination

param.name: AFS_AMSL_LIMIT
param.documentation: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

param.humanName: Error margin for GPS based AMSL limit
param.name: AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS
param.documentation: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.

param.name: AFS_QNH_PRESSURE
param.documentation: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

param.humanName: Maximum number of GPS loss events
param.name: AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS
param.documentation: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.

param.humanName: Maximum number of comms loss events
param.name: AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS
param.documentation: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.

param.name: AFS_GEOFENCE
param.documentation: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

param.name: AFS_RC
param.documentation: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

param.humanName: Enable RC Termination only in manual control modes
param.name: AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY
param.documentation: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.

param.humanName: Enable dual loss terminate due to failure of both GCS and GPS simultaneously
param.name: AFS_DUAL_LOSS
param.documentation: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.

param.name: AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME
param.documentation: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

param.name: AFS_MAX_RANGE
param.documentation: This is the maximum range of the vehicle in kilometers from first arming. If the vehicle goes beyond this range then the TERM_ACTION is performed. A value of zero disables this feature.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS whenever it is available.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: ARMING_REQUIRE
param.documentation: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and sends the minimum throttle PWM value to the throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.

param.name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
param.documentation: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

param.name: ARMING_RUDDER
param.documentation: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

param.name: ARMING_MIS_ITEMS
param.documentation: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

param.name: ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72. For most users it is recommended that you set this to 1 to enable all checks.
param.field: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,9:Airspeed,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder

param.name: ARSPD_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

param.name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
param.documentation: Changes the pitot tube order to specify the dynamic pressure side of the sensor. Accepts either if set to 2. Accepts only one side if set to 0 or 1 and can help detect excessive pressure on the static port without indicating positive airspeed.

param.name: ARSPD_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected

param.name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

param.name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of options to use with airspeed.
param.field: 0:Disable on sensor failure,1:Re-enable on sensor recovery

param.name: ARSPD2_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of 2nd airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD2_USE
param.documentation: use airspeed for flight control. When set to 0 airspeed sensor can be logged and displayed on a GCS but won't be used for flight. When set to 1 it will be logged and used. When set to 2 it will be only used when the throttle is zero, which can be useful in gliders with airspeed sensors behind a propeller

param.name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD2_RATIO
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration ratio

param.name: ARSPD2_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

param.humanName: Automatic airspeed ratio calibration for 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the autopilot will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%. This option should be enabled for a calibration flight then disabled again when calibration is complete. Leaving it enabled all the time is not recommended.

param.humanName: Control pitot tube order of 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the top connector on the sensor needs to be the dynamic pressure. If set to 1 then the bottom connector needs to be the dynamic pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft it receiving excessive pressure on the static port, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed calibration on startup for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD2_BUS
param.documentation: The bus number of the I2C bus to look for the sensor on

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_P
param.documentation: Steering control rate P gain. Converts the turn rate error (in radians/sec) to a steering control output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_I
param.documentation: Steering control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired turn rate (in rad/s) and actual

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Steering control I gain maximum. Constraings the steering output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_D
param.documentation: Steering control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired turn rate vs actual

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_FF
param.documentation: Steering control feed forward

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_FILT
param.documentation: Steering control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Steering control Target filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_FLTT
param.documentation: Target filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Steering control Error filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_FLTE
param.documentation: Error filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Steering control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_FLTD
param.documentation: Derivative filter frequency in Hz

param.name: ATC_SPEED_P
param.documentation: Speed control P gain. Converts the error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed to a motor output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: ATC_SPEED_I
param.documentation: Speed control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed

param.name: ATC_SPEED_IMAX
param.documentation: Speed control I gain maximum. Constraings the maximum motor output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

param.name: ATC_SPEED_D
param.documentation: Speed control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual

param.name: ATC_SPEED_FF
param.documentation: Speed control feed forward

param.name: ATC_SPEED_FILT
param.documentation: Speed control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Speed control Target filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SPEED_FLTT
param.documentation: Target filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Speed control Error filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SPEED_FLTE
param.documentation: Error filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Speed control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SPEED_FLTD
param.documentation: Derivative filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s
param.name: ATC_ACCEL_MAX
param.documentation: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s. 0 to disable acceleration limiting

param.name: ATC_BRAKE
param.documentation: Speed control brake enable/disable. Allows sending a reversed output to the motors to slow the vehicle.

param.name: ATC_STOP_SPEED
param.documentation: Speed control stop speed. Motor outputs to zero once vehicle speed falls below this value

param.name: ATC_STR_ANG_P
param.documentation: Steering control angle P gain. Converts the error between the desired heading/yaw (in radians) and actual heading/yaw to a desired turn rate (in rad/sec)

param.name: ATC_STR_ACC_MAX
param.documentation: Steering control angular acceleration maximum (in deg/s/s). 0 to disable acceleration limiting

param.name: ATC_STR_RAT_MAX
param.documentation: Steering control rotation rate maximum in deg/s. 0 to remove rate limiting

param.humanName: Speed control deceleration maximum in m/s/s
param.name: ATC_DECEL_MAX
param.documentation: Speed control and deceleration maximum in m/s/s. 0 to use ATC_ACCEL_MAX for deceleration

param.name: ATC_BAL_P
param.documentation: Pitch control P gain for BalanceBots. Converts the error between the desired pitch (in radians) and actual pitch to a motor output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: ATC_BAL_I
param.documentation: Pitch control I gain for BalanceBots. Corrects long term error between the desired pitch (in radians) and actual pitch

param.name: ATC_BAL_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch control I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

param.name: ATC_BAL_D
param.documentation: Pitch control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch vs actual

param.name: ATC_BAL_FF
param.documentation: Pitch control feed forward

param.name: ATC_BAL_FILT
param.documentation: Pitch control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Pitch control Target filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_BAL_FLTT
param.documentation: Target filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch control Error filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_BAL_FLTE
param.documentation: Error filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_BAL_FLTD
param.documentation: Derivative filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch control feed forward from speed
param.name: ATC_BAL_SPD_FF
param.documentation: Pitch control feed forward from speed

param.name: ATC_SAIL_P
param.documentation: Sail Heel control P gain for sailboats. Converts the error between the desired heel angle (in radians) and actual heel to a main sail output (in the range -1 to +1)

param.name: ATC_SAIL_I
param.documentation: Sail Heel control I gain for sailboats. Corrects long term error between the desired heel angle (in radians) and actual

param.humanName: Sail Heel control I gain maximum
param.name: ATC_SAIL_IMAX
param.documentation: Sail Heel control I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum I term contribution to the main sail output (range -1 to +1)

param.name: ATC_SAIL_D
param.documentation: Sail Heel control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired heel angle vs actual

param.name: ATC_SAIL_FF
param.documentation: Sail Heel control feed forward

param.name: ATC_SAIL_FILT
param.documentation: Sail Heel control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.humanName: Sail Heel Target filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SAIL_FLTT
param.documentation: Target filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Sail Heel Error filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SAIL_FLTE
param.documentation: Error filter frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Sail Heel Derivative term filter frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_SAIL_FLTD
param.documentation: Derivative filter frequency in Hz

param.name: AVOID_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enabled/disable avoidance input sources

param.humanName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes
param.name: AVOID_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

param.humanName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes
param.name: AVOID_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

param.humanName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes
param.name: AVOID_MARGIN
param.documentation: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

param.name: AVOID_BEHAVE
param.documentation: Avoidance behaviour (slide or stop)

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_WATT_MAX
param.documentation: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT8_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT8_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT8__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT9_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT9_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT9_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT9_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT9_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT9_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT9_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT9_WATT_MAX
param.documentation: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT9_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT9_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT9_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT9_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT9_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT9_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT9__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN

param.name: BATT_LOW_TIMER

If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT_LOW_MAH

If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT_CRT_MAH

param.humanName: Beacon based position estimation device type
param.name: BCN_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of beacon based position estimation device is connected

param.name: BCN_LATITUDE
param.documentation: Beacon origin's latitude

param.name: BCN_LONGITUDE
param.documentation: Beacon origin's longitude

param.humanName: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters
param.name: BCN_ALT
param.documentation: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters

param.humanName: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees
param.name: BCN_ORIENT_YAW
param.documentation: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees

param.name: BRD_PWM_COUNT
param.documentation: Controls number of FMU outputs which are setup for PWM. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and STATE. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Enable use of safety arming switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETYENABLE
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.humanName: Channels which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what channels can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP
param.documentation: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. DO NOT SET -1 on The Cube. A value of -1 sets PH1 behaviour

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

param.name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
param.documentation: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
param.field: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
param.documentation: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

param.name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
param.documentation: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

param.name: BRD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Board specific option flags

param.name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
param.documentation: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

param.humanName: Set type of direct attached radio
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
param.documentation: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
param.documentation: Select air protocol

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
param.documentation: radio debug level

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
param.documentation: disable receive CRC (for debug)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
param.documentation: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
param.documentation: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

param.humanName: Put radio into FCC test mode
param.name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
param.documentation: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

param.humanName: Set radio to factory test channel
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
param.documentation: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

param.humanName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
param.documentation: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
param.documentation: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
param.documentation: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
param.documentation: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

param.name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
param.documentation: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

param.name: BTN_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the button checking module. When this is disabled the parameters for setting button inputs are not visible

param.name: BTN_PIN1
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for second button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for third button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for fourth button input.

param.name: BTN_REPORT_SEND
param.documentation: The duration in seconds that a BUTTON_CHANGE report is repeatedly sent to the GCS regarding a button changing state. Note that the BUTTON_CHANGE message is MAVLink2 only.

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

param.name: CAM_RELAY_ON
param.documentation: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

param.name: CAM_MIN_INTERVAL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

param.name: CAM_MAX_ROLL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option.

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

param.name: CAM_AUTO_ONLY
param.documentation: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

param.name: CAM_TYPE
param.documentation: Set the camera type that is being used, certain cameras have custom functions that need further configuration, this enables that.

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D3_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P1_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P1_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.humanName: Level of debug for CAN devices
param.name: CAN_P1_DEBUG
param.documentation: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P2_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P2_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.humanName: Level of debug for CAN devices
param.name: CAN_P2_DEBUG
param.documentation: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P3_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P3_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.humanName: Level of debug for CAN devices
param.name: CAN_P3_DEBUG
param.documentation: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_CPORT
param.documentation: CAN Driver ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM
param.documentation: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT
param.documentation: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original protocol in seconds.

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_PRIMARY
param.documentation: If more than one compass is available, this selects which compass is the primary. When external compasses are connected, they will be ordered first. NOTE: If no external compass is attached, this parameter is ignored.

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID2
param.documentation: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID3
param.documentation: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_USE2
param.documentation: Enable or disable the second compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT2
param.documentation: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.humanName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN2
param.documentation: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_USE3
param.documentation: Enable or disable the third compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT3
param.documentation: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.humanName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERN3
param.documentation: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA2_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI2_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_X
param.documentation: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_Y
param.documentation: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_DIA3_Z
param.documentation: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_X
param.documentation: ODI_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_Y
param.documentation: ODI_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_ODI3_Z
param.documentation: ODI_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: COMPASS_OFFS_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

param.name: COMPASS_TYPEMASK
param.documentation: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: COMPASS_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: COMPASS_AUTO_ROT
param.documentation: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

param.name: COMPASS_EXP_DID
param.documentation: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

param.name: COMPASS_EXP_DID2
param.documentation: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID2, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

param.name: COMPASS_EXP_DID3
param.documentation: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID3, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

param.name: COMPASS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EN
param.documentation: This enables per-motor compass corrections

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EXP
param.documentation: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

param.name: EK2_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF2. Enabling EKF2 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=2. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK2_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK2_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.

param.name: EK2_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position or external navigation system position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position or external navigation system position measurements.

param.name: EK2_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

param.name: EK2_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: Primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, baro is used. 1 uses the range finder and only with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3), Do not use "1" for terrain following. NOTE: the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.

param.name: EK2_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

param.name: EK2_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK2_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK2_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK2_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK2_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK2_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK2_MAG_MASK parameter.

param.name: EK2_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK2_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EK2_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.
